summary: This is a stipulation filed with the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, agreeing to dismiss Jeffrey Epstein's appeal with prejudice. The document is signed by legal counsel for both Epstein and the United States, indicating a resolution of the appellate matter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal appeal case, whose appeal is being dismissed with prejudice per this stipulation.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein in the appeal; signed the stipulation document.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein in the appeal; listed as counsel on the document.

connections.description: Weingarten is listed as counsel representing Epstein in the appeal.
Weinberg is listed as counsel representing Epstein in the appeal.

events.title: Dismissal of Epstein's Appeal
events.description: The parties stipulate to dismiss Jeffrey Epstein's criminal appeal with prejudice, meaning it cannot be reinstated.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's criminal appeal (Appeal No. 19-2221-cr) is being dismissed with prejudice.
The dismissal is stipulated by both Epstein's counsel and the United States government.
Once dismissed, the appeal may not be reinstated.
Neither party shall recover costs, expenses, or fees from the other.
The document is executed in August 2019, shortly before Epstein's death.
